author: The UB Post
title: Mongolian artists unveil exhibition in Berkeley
text:
Thursday, October 8th,   Mongolian artists unveil exhibition in Berkeley 
By B.BAATAR 
Through the Mongolia Celebration event, dedicated to the revival of Mongolian language program and the establishment of the Center for Mongolian Studies at the University of California, Berkeley, two separate Mongolian art exhibitions opened in the San Francisco Bay Area. The exhibition “Visions from Afar” by Mongolian artists S.Turburam, S.Tamir and B.Enkhbat, who live in the San Francisco Bay Area, opened at the Silk Road Gallery in Berkeley on October 4. It displayed cutout art pieces expressing Mongolia’s national culture and historic designs by famous artist S.Turburam, black and white portrait-paintings of artists and celebrities of Mongolia and Hollywood, as well as the paintings illustrating the combinations of traditional and modern perspectives by B.Enkhbat. Famous Mongolian female artists S.Tugs-Oyun, J.Munkhtsetseg and B.Nomin opened their exhibition “Three Gems” at UC Berkeley on October 6. Visitors enjoyed asymmetrical paintings of Mongolian livelihood and culture by S.Tugs-Oyun, artworks expressing inner worlds of people by J.Munkhtsetseg, and interesting traditional design paintings expressing modern lifestyle in Mongolia by young modernist B.Nomin.
